Key: Phew, that should do it.

(Phew. I didn't expect to have after-school duties
today... No one's left in the classroom but me.)

(Well, I still have to get ready for dinner, but I have
time. I'll drop by the market to pick up some food.)
Oh...

(Come to think of it, Rinne said she's going to be
handling it. Then I have nothing else I can think of
doing. Hm... I guess I'll just go home and help Rinne.)

(Wait a minute... Now that Rinne and Maria are here,
not to mention tomorrow's meals, Rinne won't be able
to buy everything on her own, huh?)
My, Shido-san, you're still here?
Kurumi...?! What are you doing here?

Hehe... Oh Shido. Why are you surprised? I'm your
classmate, it's only natural that we meet in the
classroom.
Oh, you're right... Sorry.

Not at all. Anyways, Shido-san, do you have any plans
after this?
Well... I guess I don't until nighttime.
Then that's great. Would you come shopping with me?
...Just the two of us?
Yes, just the two of us.
Uh...

(I feel like if I just tag along, Kotori will be mad, but...
I guess we'll be fine now. And maybe Kurumi might
notice something like last time.)

...Got it. I'll go with you. But what are you going to
buy?
Well, that is for you to see when we get there.
Why do I have a bad feeling about this...
Wait a minute.
Whoa?! Origami?!
My... Origami-san, you're still here?
So fake. You knew I was here.
Not at all. I am just a cute, ordinary girl.

Anyways, Shido. I can't allow you to go out alone with
Kurumi Tokisaki.
Wh-What's going on?

There's a high chance that Kurumi Tokisaki will
approach you in a bold way. As your girlfriend, I have
a duty to protect you from this temptation.
Well, um―

We can't say it won't happen for sure. She has proved
you wrong before.

My, my. You sure seem to be putting up your guard
around me.
Of course. I won't allow you to be alone with Shido.

Very well... Would you like to join us, Origami-san?
That way, we will be sufficiently chaperoned to your
satisfaction.

...There's nothing to consider. Shido would want to
walk home alone with me.
Then Shido-san, please make your decision.

(Hm... What do I do? Origami and Kurumi... I'm afraid
of what'll happen if I decide on one over the
other...)

Hmm... Well I did make plans with Kurumi first. So,
why don't the three of us go together? Are you okay
with that?
Fine. Then I will protect you, Shido.
Hehehe... This will surely become a fun excursion.
(Um... Did I make the wrong decision?)

(Kurumi had brought us to a general goods store. She
wanted to check something out here, but...)

Shido-san, look. Wouldn't you say this is quite
gorgeous?
Let me see... Wait, is that a fruit knife?

Yes. Other knives are a bit too big, so I was looking
for the right size.

I see. Wow, the handle looks like a rose. I feel like
it really suits you, Kurumi.
Thank you, Shido-san. Then how about this?

Looks like a black wing, huh? That seems to suit you
too, but... I would say I like the rose one better.
*Giggle*... Then I'll buy the first one, then.
Yeah, sounds good. It looks elegant.

My, my. Then I suppose it'll be a fine accessory to
walk around with at all times.
Yeah... Hey, wait! That's scary!

Hehe... I was only kidding. Oh Shido-san, your
reactions are so priceless.
Don't make fun of me...
I'll be careful. I'm going to go pay, okay?
Hm...? What are you looking at, Origami?
This is an item we need in our life together.
Is that a... sheet?

Yes. A magic sheet that repels dirt. This is a
necessity in our future activities. If we put this on
your bed, Shido, your family won't catch us.
I wonder what you're planning on doing!

...Shido, you're so bold. To ask a lady to say such a
thing.
Oh, come on! That's not what I meant!

It's fine. Nothing about you bothers me, Shido. In
fact, I rather welcome that side of you.

Hey! My bed is intended for one person! We won't be
sleeping together!
...Shido, you're so shy.
Whatever, just don't put this in my house...
Unfortunate. Then I'll just buy one for myself.
...You're going to buy it?
Thanks to you, I was able to make a good purchase.

I was able to buy something awesome thanks to you
too, Shido.

Yeah, what an honor to be of service. I didn't do
much, though. So where are we going next? I know
this isn't the end.
Hmm... Origami-san, why don't we battle?

...Battle? Bring it on. No matter how many times we
go, I'll win.

My, you sure seem confident. Then I look forward to
seeing the results.
Your confidence will be your downfall.

(This is going the wrong direction... But they do seem
to be getting along to a certain extent.)
So what kind of battle are you thinking about?
It's obvious what we're going to do.

Well in a store like this, there's only one thing to do.
We're going to have a mini fashion show.
Shido, you'll be the judge.

O-Okay. I got it, but you guys are really starting to
act like Kaguya and Yuzuru...

(The two glared at one another and went into their
fitting rooms.)

(They both have a very unique fashion sense, but not
in a bad way. As long as I don't make any
inappropriate comments, I should be fine.)
Shido-saaaan. I'm done changing.
I'm ready as well.
Uh, what am I supposed to do?

I'll open the door now. Origami-san, you're ready,
right?
Then together... One, two...
You guys... What are you wearing?!

(I couldn't help but be shocked. From the narrow
openings between my fingers, I could see their
mesmerizing bodies.)
My, is there something wrong?
Well, um... If I'm not mistaken... it's clearly...
No matter how you look at it, it's underwear.
Oh, wait a minute! You said fashion show earlier!

Shido-san. Don't be prejudiced. Underwear is totally
part of fashion.
That's true, but...

(I totally let my guard down. I never expected
lingerie...)

In order to be judged fairly, we chose the same
lingerie. Shido, which looks better?
I won't allow you to say we both look good in it.

It's also acceptable to say which of the two you want
to take off first.

(No, that's beyond the point. I can't... get myself to
look at them.)

Hehe. Shido-san, I know this isn't your first time, so
you don't have to be so shy. When I first transferred,
you chose lingerie for me, remember?

Yeah but the circumstances were different...!
I mean, you two look too good... I really can't
choose.
My... *giggle*.
Shido...
Wh-What's wrong?

No, your words were so honest, I started to feel it
was dumb of me to be making a competition out of
this.

Yes. What you said were words that came from the
heart. I honestly am happy to hear that.

So I'm going to say this again. You guys both look
great. You guys are both attractive in your own ways,
and I can't put a number to that...

That's very much like you, Shido-san. I don't mind
that side of you. However, you're only going to shoot
yourself in the foot by prolonging your decision.

Shido, I know you'll choose me in the end. So it's not
going to end like this.

I believe you're just forcing your ideals onto him.
Maybe that's a form of dependency.
That's not true...!

I hope so. In the end, it's up to you, Shido-san.
Right?

You guys... I'm happy to chat, but can we continue
after you change...? I don't like how people are
watching...

(Before we knew it, we were surrounded by girls.
I had the feeling they were all whispering about me.)
Okay. Hold on.
Me, too.

(In the end they both bought the lingerie they tried
on. We left the store around nightfall.)

It's pretty late. Why don't we go home? I need to
prepare for dinner.

Got it. We'll end it here. Kurumi Tokisaki... We'll settle
this eventually.
Right. When the time comes, bring it on.
You guys are still going at it....
Next time, I'll be sure to win. Brace yourself.

There is no such thing as certainty in battle.
Origami-san, you should be prepared to lose.
No need.

How long are you two going to do this...? Anyways,
I'm that way.
Okay Shido, I'll see you later.
Yes, Shido-san. I will see you later, okay?
Okay.

(The two went their separate ways, and I realized
something.)
What do they mean... later?

(I pondered in peace until I got home, where I
discovered that Rinne had invited both Origami and
Kurumi.)
